image.altText: NSW Police and Fire and Rescue NSW crews at Welfare Avenue, Beverley Hills after a car was set alight

props.synopsis: Police were called to a home in Bankstown on Friday night after reports a woman, 45, was taken into a SUV by kidnappers "armed with a firearm".

title.children: Sydney woman's 'horrendous' abduction a 'targeted incident,' police say

image.altText: A close up of a Hesta sign on a wall.

props.synopsis: HESTA won't process super contributions, regular withdraws, investment switches and insurance claims until June, due to a system changeover. Consumer advocates and members have expressed concern about the freeze on funds.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest super funds is freezing services until June

image.altText: Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton, now seriously on the back foot, has made an extraordinarily big "aspirational" commitment at the back end of this campaign.

title.children: Dutton's tax 'aspiration' is his most radical idea since nuclear power

image.altText: Graffiti has been sprayed on Dutton's office.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton have both begun their campaigning in Sydney today. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton's office vandalised as Good Friday slows campaign pace

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dutton's electorate office vandalised in Brisbane
Parishioners gather in their thousands at Saint Charbel's

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Prabowo Subianto shake hands in front of Indonesian and Russian flags

props.synopsis: While 70 per cent of Australians surveyed hold a "very unfavourable" view of Russia, that's only the case for 6 per cent of Indonesians.

title.children: Indonesia-Russia ties are friendly. Experts say that's not cause for alarm

image.altText: A close-up of a page with a clownfish in Billie Dunn's copy of William Saville-Kent's blood on the reef.

props.synopsis: Striking historic drawings of the Great Barrier Reef found in an old, waterlogged book capture the spell this underwater world has put on people for centuries.

title.children: Historic book captures our obsession with Earth's largest living structure

image.altText: Ramos Horta Timor leste reuters

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste's President Jose Ramos Horta has said his country's forces could join with China's as long as the activity is "not directed at any perceived hostile entity".

title.children: A close Australian neighbour is open to military drills with China

image.altText: A stretch of beach, viewed from above.

props.synopsis: A woman has died and a man is missing after three people were swept into the ocean at San Remo, south-east of Melbourne, on Friday morning.

title.children: Woman dead, man missing after trio swept off rocks at San Remo

image.altText: A man with long blonde hair speaks to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's comments came after he indicated Beijing was keen to meet to discuss the tariff war the two countries are locked in.

title.children: Trump says 'very good' trade deal will be made with China

image.altText: truck and rv parked on acreage near a creek

props.synopsis: Show-cause notices have been sent to property owners running small-scale campsites in Queensland's Scenic Rim, but they say the regulations are unfair and should only apply to tourist parks.

title.children: Farmers given show-cause notice for hosting campers without a permit

image.altText: Silhouettes of laptop and mobile device users are seen next to a screen projection of Microsoft logo

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is a scammer's newest tool as experts warn they can generate fake photos, voice clones, phishing emails and fake websites “at an increasingly rapid rate”.

title.children: As scammers latch on to AI, Microsoft says it blocks 1.6 million bots every hour

image.altText: A close-up of Luigi Mangione.

props.synopsis: The indictment returned by a grand jury also charges Luigi Mangione with two counts of stalking and a firearms count.

title.children: Luigi Mangione indicted on murder charge in step towards death penalty

image.altText: A man looks to kick during an AFL match

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions star Lachie Neale has delivered a scathing take-down of the online abuse faced by his teammates following their loss to Collingwood on Thursday night.

title.children: 'A stain on society': Brisbane's Lachie Neale condemns online trolls

image.altText: A composite image of a man and woman talking to each other.

props.synopsis: Clare O'Neil accuses Michael Sukkar of speaking "absolute garbage" on social housing as 7.30 host Sarah Ferguson delivers an iconic live television moment.

title.children: Sukkar shut down during wild election housing debate

image.altText: Rory McIlroy on his knees

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A pop star in space, McIlroy's stirring win and mounds of rubbish

image.altText: Jacob cuddles a lamb in his arms

props.synopsis: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

title.children: They can't vote yet but these country kids want more from politicians

image.altText: a cyclone tracking map

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Errol is expected to cross the coast in Western Australia's far north as a tropical low later today.

title.children: Cyclone Errol expected to hit Kimberley coast as a tropical low

image.altText: A cartoon of a woman sitting at a laptop, with the words "cancelled" on the screen.

props.synopsis: Plans to expand automated decision-making in New Zealand's welfare sector has charities and legal experts concerned.

title.children: Could New Zealand be headed for its own Robodebt episode?

image.altText: Rescue worker in neon green gear amidst dense forest foliage and branches, with a broken cable car window visible.

props.synopsis: A cable car carrying tourists south of Naples crashed on Thursday after the cable snapped, officials say. Sixteen passengers in a separate cabin that stopped mid-air had to also be evacuated.

title.children: Four killed and sixteen others rescued after cable car crash in Italy

image.altText: a tasmania police badge

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old man has died in hospital after being hit and critically injured by a car in Hobart's CBD 10 days ago.

title.children: Elderly pedestrian dies from injuries after Hobart CBD crash

image.altText: Two booking photos provided by the California Department of Corrections shows Erik Menendez, left, and Lyle Menendez.

props.synopsis: Erik and Lyle Menendez's bid for shorter sentences and a shot at freedom has been delayed again due to disputes among prosecutors and the brothers' lawyers.

title.children: The Menendez brothers' bid for a shorter sentence is delayed again

image.altText: Statue holding the scales of justice (Reuters)

props.synopsis: The controversial law of sacrilege — which carries the same maximum penalty of life in jail as murder — still exists in South Australia, but some say it shouldn't.

title.children: An SA man faces life in prison for sacrilege. What does the controversial charge mean?

image.altText: a man looking at the camera with glasses on

props.synopsis: Rocked by a coal-fired controversy, the LNP has been sent into damage control for the first time since its Queensland election win, writes Alex Brewster.

title.children: Blast from the past as Callide power plant presents first scandal for LNP

image.altText: Jon appears to adjust a cufflink while wearing a black suit with a bow tie and looking worried at an evening event.

props.synopsis: Jon Hamm returns to what he does best in his latest drama series — with one big twist. Let us tell you about Your Friends and Neighbors and the other best new series ready for streaming this Easter long weekend.

title.children: 5 shows to watch this Easter weekend, starting with new Jon Hamm drama

image.altText: An airport terminal with blue ground equipment and a control tower under a clear sky.

props.synopsis: A passenger fatally shot the hijacker with a licensed firearm, allowing the small plane to land safely outside Belize City.

title.children: US citizen hijacks plane in Belize, fatally shot by passenger

image.altText: Jerome Powell standing at a lectern with Donald Trump behind him.

props.synopsis: The president has placed the head of the US central bank in his sights, floating a move that could cause market chaos and undermine the independence of the Federal Reserve.

title.children: Trump says US Federal Reserve boss' termination 'cannot come fast enough'

image.altText: A group of students stand in front of a building

props.synopsis: Five people were hospitalised when the gunman rampaged through Florida State University, shooting at students, before he was shot and injured by local law enforcement.

title.children: Two dead as police officer's son fires old service weapon at US university

image.altText: A surfer in a dark wetsuit skirts the centre crest of a wave, with white sea spray rising behind him.

props.synopsis: The future of remote WA surfing hotspot "Tombstones" hangs in the balance as locals hope the future buyer of the station connected to it will keep accommodation affordable.

title.children: Nervous wait for surfers as station around famous break for sale

image.altText: A woman with her arm around another woman and a schooner in her other hand

props.synopsis: At the Humpty Doo pub in Darwin's rural area, thousands of kilometres from Canberra, the views of punters reflect the challenges facing candidates nationwide this election.

title.children: Putting politics to the punters at the Humpty Doo pub

image.altText: A small baby's hand clutching the thumb of a parent.

props.synopsis: A Queensland Health spokesperson said early investigations suggested human error and a failure to follow processes were behind the Monash IVF mistake, which resulted in a patient being implanted with another woman's embryo.

title.children: Health regulator visits every Monash IVF clinic in Queensland after embryo mix-up

image.altText: An elderly woman standing on a boat.

props.synopsis: The oldest woman to sail solo around the world, Jeanne Socrates, still spends most of her days on the ocean with just birds and dolphins for company.

title.children: At 82, Jeanne is still charting a 'marvellous' solo life on the high seas

image.altText: old woman in pink top with neutral expression standing on a school crossing

props.synopsis: The longtime primary school crossing guard wins an unfair dismissal case against a regional Victorian council that sacked her due to a disputed knee injury.

title.children: Council's sacking of 86yo lollipop lady found to be unfair

image.altText: A man on a horse carrying a whip tries to stop three other horses running away

props.synopsis: Rangers are scouring Victoria's high country for a horse that escaped handlers during a re-enactment of Banjo Patterson's Man From Snowy River poem.

title.children: Horse still missing a week after Man From Snowy River re-enactment goes awry

image.altText: Ladybirds gathered on dry grass with others behind on the ground

props.synopsis: Dry but cool conditions in South Australia's south east are causing ladybirds to gather in huge numbers, which an ecologist says will help control a destructive plant pest.

title.children: Drought brings out millions of ladybirds — but it's a good thing
